I'm not the mosts observant guy but some time ago, the forum had a button/link to search for new posts since the last time you were connected (common across many forums). It seems to have vanished.

After a bit of digging, I find that the only way to do this now is to use Advanced Search->Find Posts (since last visit)->Search Now. Sure, I can save this as my preferred search but that's still twice as many clicks and UI maneuvering from screen top to bottom. Outrageous, I know.

Is there a 'New Posts' search button I'm unaware of?
I see a "New Posts" buton on the left of the header of this page. Is that not displaying for you? (Oh, and thread moved to Kerbal Network.)
I have that url saved as my KSP Forums bookmark. I almost never visit the main page.

Either I am blind -- I am certain the left-most link in the header was only "What's New?" -- or someone made a ninja edit to something.

Chalk this up to user error. Dumb users...

There is an issue, depending on how wide the browser window is. If it's too narrow, the first menu row wraps on top of the second row, obscuring the new posts link.
